snippet: Some Brooklyn schools are receiving federal money to spur desegregation. But the process is complicated by geography, the Supreme Court and city priorities.
abstract: Public School 257 in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, is one of four schools in the neighborhood that has received a 2010 magnet grant from the federal Education Department to spur desegregation; school faces numerous hurdles in the integration process, including geography, city priorities and battles for resources and test scores.
lead_paragraph: Some Brooklyn schools are receiving federal money to spur desegregation. But the process is complicated by geography, the Supreme Court and city priorities.

headline.print_headline: Integrating a School, One Child at a Time
headline.seo: Brooklyn Magnet Schools See Hurdles to Integration, Even in Kindergarten
headline.main: Integrating a School, One Child at a Time
